title: Condensed Deco Fonts
content:
Hi,

I came across this logo recently for Centropolis and love the condensed deco font. I tried finding it but couldn’t. Silhouette is the closest I got: [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/letterperfect/silhouette/silhouette/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080504200114/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/letterperfect/silhouette/silhouette/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/letterperfect/silhouette/silhouette/")

Any suggestions? Any fonts that look like this?

Thanks,

Tal

 [‹ Critique of magazine logo design](http://web.archive.org/web/20080504200114/http:/www.typophile.com/node/36582 "Go to previous forum topic") [High School Newspaper critique ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080504200114/http:/www.typophile.com/node/36765 "Go to next forum topic")
author: talgoretsky

comments.content: Try Huxley Vertical with alternate characters

Or for a less condensed alternative, [Aldous Vertical](http://web.archive.org/web/20080504200114/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/creative_alliance/aldous_vertical/?sample_text=CENTROPOLIS&sample_size=48).

Stephen, you nailed it! That’s the one they’re using in Centropolis. Thanks!

Curious, if I were to search Fontshop for this font, what keywords would I use besides Deco?

There aren’t too many other [keywords attached to Aldous](http://web.archive.org/web/20080504200114/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/creative_alliance/aldous_vertical/) on fontshop.com, but if you had a [FontBook](http://web.archive.org/web/20080504200114/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/FontBook) you would have found it pretty quick as a See Also reference under Huxley and others. We want to get that cross-reference info on the site someday.
Thans, Stephen. I need to get a FontBook pronto.
